messages.title: Scrap tuition fees
messages.content: A Lib Dem government will scrap student fees.

messages.title: Guided Bus plans descend into farce
messages.content: Already more than six months late, plans for the Guided Busway to open seem to have been put on indefinite hold.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Scrap student fees, a message from Lib Dem leader Nick Clegg, with a committed six-year program.
Opposition to the Guided Bus, which is more than six months late and rumored to be millions over budget.

mentions.tacticalSituation: Signs of a Conservative recovery are not expected in Cambridge. In 2009, the city’s Conservative Party failed to win a single seat on Cambridge City Council, showing that local conservatives are in a tough situation there, and a tactical vote would be a lost one with the Liberal Democrats.

issues.education: A Lib Dem government will scrap student fees as part of their key message. After the General Election, the Labour government has said there will be a vote on whether to increase fees to £3,000 and both Labour and the Conservatives are in favor of increasing fees.

images.caption: Local Liberal Democrat Parliamentary Candidate Julian Huppert with some of Cambridge's Lib Dem students, who are campaigning to end student fees.
Julian Huppert led the opposition to the Guided Bus, which is now more than six months late and rumoured to be millions over budget.
